summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Verizon Communications, demanding extensive telephone records for the period from July 6, 2019 onward. The subpoena is related to an investigation into alleged violations of federal conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction statutes.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena to Verizon Communications.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Verizon
events.description: The subpoena commands Verizon to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce records, though appearance can be avoided by producing the records by the deadline.

events.title: Start Date for Records Request
events.description: The subpoena requests all telephone records from this date forward, indicating the investigation's focus on activity from this period.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The subpoena targets Verizon Communications for extensive telephone records, including call details, text message toll information, subscriber data, and device identifiers.
The investigation concerns alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (obstruction).
The records request period begins on July 6, 2019, suggesting the investigation was active around that time, possibly related to events following Jeffrey Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
The subpoena allows Verizon to avoid a physical appearance by producing the records with a custodian declaration by the return date.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, indicating high-level federal involvement in the investigation.
